alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 11 at 10:31AM CST until January 13 at 6:00AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow, mixed precipitation, and blowing snow. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...In Iowa, Lee County. In Illinois, Hancock and McDonough Counties. In Missouri, Scotland and Clark Counties. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 6 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact both the morning and evening commutes on Friday and anyone traveling Friday into Saturday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will overspread the area this evening from south to north. Rain and freezing rain will mix with snow Friday morning. A period of mainly rain is expected from late tonight through noon Friday, before cold air and strong winds move in changing the precipitation back to all snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
